body_html: Pawan apparently refers to a case in which the user has separately installed Eigen so that its include files are in /usr/include/eigen3. The case I refer to, and I think is what most people have done, is to build Tensorflow from source, which includes some subset of Eigen under third_party. In this case, users are advised to build applications in the Tensorflow tree using bazel but the Tensorflow tree only includes the short Tensor include file and not the longer one that it itself attempts to include.
body_text: Pawan apparently refers to a case in which the user has separately installed Eigen so that its include files are in /usr/include/eigen3.  The case I refer to, and I think is what most people have done, is to build Tensorflow from source, which includes some subset of Eigen under third_party.  In this case, users are advised to build applications in the Tensorflow tree using bazel but the Tensorflow tree only includes the short Tensor include file and not the longer one that it itself attempts to include.
body: Pawan apparently refers to a case in which the user has separately installed Eigen so that its include files are in /usr/include/eigen3.  The case I refer to, and I think is what most people have done, is to build Tensorflow from source, which includes some subset of Eigen under third_party.  In this case, users are advised to build applications in the Tensorflow tree using bazel but the Tensorflow tree only includes the short Tensor include file and not the longer one that it itself attempts to include.
